resources.string: The Cerro de Monserrate is the best known of the eastern hills of Bogotá. The hills of Bogotá are at least 16 million years old. The basilica of the Lord of Monserrate has been a place of religious pilgrimage since colonial times and is a natural, religious, and gastronomic attraction of the city.

In 1620 the Fernández Valenzuela Family built the first chapels on the hill. Pedro Fernández built the chapel in homage to the Santa Cruz de Monserrate. The Sanctuary of Señor Caido de Monserrate has a Neolithic style, designed by Arturo Jaramillo and completed around 1925
Casa San Isidro Restaurant (European Gastronomy) y Casa Santa Clara Restaurant (Typical Colombian gastronomy)
